title: Unai Emery tells Arsenal he is happy with squad ahead of January transfer window
text:
Emery is happy with his squad (Picture: Getty)

Arsenal are unlikely to make any signings in the January transfer window as Unai Emery is happy with his current squad, reports say.

Emery’s side sit third in the Premier League after a steady start to the campaign, but many fans will be hoping for defensive reinforcements in the near future.

There are questions about the long-term futures of David Luiz and Sokratis Papastathopoulos after several high-profile errors from the centre-back pairing.

However, the Athletic claim Arsenal are not planning to address their defensive woes in the January market.

Upamecano was a summer target of Arsenal’s (Picture: Getty)

Arsenal have been linked with the likes of RB Leipzig’s Dayot Upamecano, who is valued at £88million by his club.

The Gunners balked at that asking price during the summer and will not move again for the 20-year-old when the winter window opens.

Emery is satisfied with his current squad and the options available to him, which means the Londoners will be in for a quiet window.

One outgoing could be Mesut Ozil, with the German struggling to even make Emery’s matchday squads at the moment.

Arsenal are reportedly keen to offload the playmaker, but his huge wages will be an obstacle to any deal in January.
